ai.summary: A moderate 12.8 km section of the Green Chain Walk, offering mixed terrain and scenic views along the UK’s coastal fringe. This section suits hikers with steady fitness who enjoy urban fringe scenery, parklands and intermittent coastal vistas.
ai.terrain_summary: The route uses a mix of paved paths, compact gravel tracks, grassy field edges and woodland trails. Expect some uneven surfaces, gentle gradients and occasional muddy patches, with potential curb cuts or steps in built-up sections.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times for coastal segments and be mindful of coastal winds. Wear sturdy footwear for uneven surfaces. Keep to marked paths, watch for road crossings in urban fringe areas, and carry a map or offline navigation. Stay hydrated, protect yourself from sun or rain, and keep pets under control.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Map or offline navigation app, charged phone
Small first aid kit and emergency whistle
Headlamp or flashlight (if finishing near dusk)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March–October) for milder weather and better daylight; summer offers longer daylight but can be busy and exposed to sun; winter can be muddy and less pleasant with shorter days.

seo.title: Green Chain Walk Section 6 – 12.8 km Moderate Trek in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Green Chain Walk Section 6, a 12.8 km moderate hike through mixed terrain in the UK. Coasts, parks and urban fringe scenery with practical safety tips and gear.
